entry.content:
Smoke Forecast Outlook issued August 31, 2017 at 11:03 AM EDT

Incident: Burdette Fire Wildfire
Released: 2 days ago

Smoke Forecast Outlook issued August 31, 2017 at 11:03 AM EDT

Outlook for Sunrise

Smoke: A dry cold front will bring westerly winds and some relief from smoke as well as cooler morning
temperatures. Much of the forecast area will remain “Moderate” for Thursday, Missoula is the exception at
"USG". Smoke is expected to filter back into valley locations overnight and remain through Friday morning.

Fire: The Sunrise fire is located 11 miles SE of Superior, MT adjacent to I-90. A red flag warning is in effect. Minimal
fire growth observed on the fire Wednesday. Increase in acreage is not expected on the Sunrise fire.

Other: A Red Flag Warning for potential new lightning starts and gusty winds is in effect until 9pm tonight. Breezy
west winds today following a weather disturbance bringing slightly cooler temperatures. Very hot and dry critical fire
weather conditions remain. Expect an increase in fire behavior. Air quality has improved across the forecast area
and is expected to remain in the “Moderate” range for Superior, Alberton, and Frenchtown. Missoula’s air quality
will be best represented by “USG”. If you live within Missoula County, please refer to the Missoula City-County Health Department for detailed smoke health information
(see link below).
